info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:55PM EDT until July 29 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN PERSON...NORTHEASTERN ORANGE AND NORTHWESTERN DURHAM COUNTIES... At 654 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Prospect Hill, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rougemont, Bushy Fork, Lake Michie, Surl, Bahama and Schley. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
